fields.description:
SVNkit does not URLencode URLs before making requests over HTTP/HTTPS.  This isn't a problem for Apache (which is the most common web server used for hosting SVN repos) but can be a problem for SVN repos hosted on other web servers such as Jetty.  Jetty will reject any URL with a non-url-encoded space in it.

I've filed a bug here with more information: [SVNKIT-491|http://issues.tmatesoft.com/issue/SVNKIT-491].

Possible workarounds:
1. Configure Fisheye/Crucible to use the SVN native client
2. Configure an apache or similar reverse proxy in front of the jetty web server
3. Use another protocol to access the repo.  E.g. svn+ssh://, or file:// after using svnsync to maintain a clone of the repository on the Fisheye server

When trying to run FishEye on Java 8 then the result is not only "unstable" but actually not working at all and you get a nice long stack trace...

This is actually an issue since FishEye does not provide its own JRE like e.g. JIRA does.

fields.description:
FE-4984 issue addressed the problem or broken handling of file and folder permissions on Windows OS.  Windows OS is not Posix compliant system and has different file permission system.  As Java lacks reliable way of managing Windows OS file permissions decision was made to stop managing that.
Instead the warning now is presented to the user intended to prompt the user to ensure that his FISHEYE_INST folder is properly secured and private keys are not accessible to unwanted users having access to the same machine.   Apparently the warning message is confusing users.
fields.summary: Unclear warning on private key file and folder permission

fields.description:
This is regression introduced in FishEye/Crucible 3.0.  In previous releases if repository permissions were configured to allow access to anonymous users, that was automatically applied to all logged in users too.  Apparently this works in 3.3 no more if Global Anonymous Access is turned off.

The UI still shows that logged users have access, see:
!https://monosnap.com/image/aXGZc1mx3H9prlEYvGeZRYwiVkLH1z.png|width=66%!
but in reality their access will be denied if they try to access a repository:
{noformat}
Permission denied
You are not allowed to access the repository XXX.
{noformat}

The issue occurs regardless if the permissions were set individually on particular repository, or if the repository was configured to user default repository permissions and default permissions were set to grant access to anonymous user

h3. Workaround
For the time being depending on your circumstances and expected access policy, consider:
 * switch on global anonymous access if appropriate in your environment, or
 * tick off anonymous user access in Repository Permissions (or Repository Default Permissions if using default permissions ) and grant access to Logged in Users or users from selected groups
fields.summary: logged in users inherit anonymous user repo permissions no more if global anon access is off

Issue facing:
When i login into fisheye then its showing as below:


The requested resource cannot be found.
Not Found

Referer:
    https://prototype.atlasian.sapient.com/fisheye/ 

You are running release CR3.2.3 FE3.2.3 (20131216163334 2013-12-16), please report your release number when reporting bugs.

Workaround:
When i disable unified navigator plugin then it gets resolved. I have followed below approaches till now:
1) RPC should be enabled.
2) Uninstall the unified navigator plugin version 2.0.1 and then upgrade fisheye. Then install latest version of unified navigator plugin i.e. 2.1.0
fields.summary: Unified navigator plugin is not behaving properly after fisheye upgrade.
Format code context shown in search results
Recent Activity fails to render in IE 9.0.8112.16421

fields.description:
Lets say you want to create a review from a commit. You can do this two ways: 
1. JIRA issue source tab, click on Create Review button.
2. Fisheye news feed, click on the Cogwheel icon on a commit and create Review.

Crucible will automatically add a *Link To..* option that helps the user to link back to the JIRA issue in the review. This does not work when that issue belongs to a project that has a custom project key pattern, e.g.:
{noformat}
TBK2-10200
{noformat}
This works normally if the project key pattern is the default JIRA one.
No errors thrown in the logs for both JIRA and Fisheye.

Tested on the follow sets of installations:
-------------------------
*JIRA 6.0.8*
*Fisheye Plugin 6.0.2*
*FeCru 3.0.3*
-------------------------
*JIRA 6.1.6*
*Fisheye Plugin 6.1.6*
*FeCru 3.2.4*
fields.summary: Crucible does not auto generate a Link To Issue Key when creating reviews from commits that have an issue key that is using a non-default project key pattern

fields.description: When a last modified filter is selected, a diff quicksearch will return all results, regardless of the query string.
fields.summary: Diff search result incorrect when a 'last modified' filter is selected

fields.description: Creating Charlietars is expensive, and they are not cached correctly. Significant CPU time can be consumed creating them.
fields.summary: Avatars are not cached

fields.description: The application index is designed to process indefinitely to overcome common network problems so that when connectivity is lost, the application will attempt to index the previously failed block of revisions again. While this works most of the time, a method to notify users/admins of (a configurable number of) failed index attempts would help admins be proactive about failures as opposed to hearing about it from end-users.
fields.summary: Proactively notify admins when repo pauses/restarts X amount of times

fields.description:
The admin setting page scrolls vertical when an item is selected from the GWT tree menu on the sidebar. The issue was tested in Google Chrome & IE it persist on all both the browsers. Tested FishEye version was 3.2.3

In order to replicate the issue, visit the following page http://localhost:8060/admin/viewServerSettings.do, scroll down till the page are scrolled more than half, then choose the Atlassian Support Tools link from the sidebar. It will cause the page to scroll vertically to the top of the page.

The issue was found to be reported in the GWT as well : https://code.google.com/p/google-web-toolkit/issues/detail?id=2467
fields.summary: The admin setting page scrolls vertical

fields.description: This a improvement request suggesting to allow the user to choose the page he wants to see when logging in FishEye. The main objective would be to allow the user to see Crucible Review Dashboard when logging.
fields.summary: Allow changing home page to "Review Dashboard"

fields.description: For the user commit history (as per the attached screenshot) it would be best, if there is an option to export the commits history into format such as spreadsheet or printable format. The user commit in the screenshot refers to a particular selected repository.
fields.summary: User Commit History Report (Export-able)

fields.description:
I was trying to create a new user but it happened that email I have provided was already used by another user.  Username of that existing user was displayed in the error message.  This seems wrong to me, FishEye instance can be configured to hide the visibility of user list and their emails but this seems to be not honoured here.
Also, can't see a real value of displaying name of existing user, simple message stating such an email address is already used by another user would do.

See !https://monosnap.com/image/KYleo6LKXP5phmf9LgSKUHORHyxSmE.png!
fields.summary: Username of existing user should not be displayed

fields.description:
Currently, file type 'text' with japanese character is not displayed correctly in FishEye/Crucible when the repository option 'Unicode Server' is enabled.

It will be better if the file type 'text' is converted to selected charset in unicode mode
fields.summary: Perforce: Files of type 'text' should be converted to selected charset in unicode mode

fields.description:
A search with an EyeQL query with the objective to do not show deleted files and folders is not working properly. Deleted files are not showed, but delete folders are.

As follows, two examples of the query:
1) select revisions where is head and not is dead return path,dir,revision,isDeleted,totalLines

2) select revisions where is head and not is dead and not is deleted return path,dir,revision,isDeleted,totalLines
fields.summary: EyeQL query doesn't show deleted files but shows deleted folders

fields.description:
In the setup wizard, if you enter a JIRA URL without a "http://" prefix, you get the error message in the attached screenshot.

Extremely confusing, and likely to generate a heap of support calls, especially since browsers like Chrome remove the {{http://}}, meaning that copy + paste will cause problems.
fields.summary: Connecting to JIRA doesn't work when configuring Fisheye on Chrome

fields.description:
This error appears when managing addons.

This version of FishEye and Crucible is unrecognized by the Atlassian Marketplace. It might be a non-standard build or be too new to appear.
fields.summary: Unrecognized version of FishEye and Crucible.

fields.description:
For Subversion repositories tags are visible in branch selectors as branches with the name 'tag:TAGNAME'.

!http://i.imgur.com/1iIzcu9.png!
fields.summary: Tags show up as branches 'tag:TAGNAME' in branch lists for SVN repositories

fields.description: After a repository is restarted the line count data seems to be reset to 0, instead of continue its process from where it stopped, making it difficult to have new changesets appearing in FishEye right after a restart.
fields.summary: Line count data is reset to 0 after restart

fields.description: This a suggestion for stopping the line count data process at some point in order to allow new changesets to be indexed and showed up in FishEye, as there might be a lot of information regarding line count data that can result in a long time to have new changesets indexed.
fields.summary: Stop line count data allowing index of new changesets

fields.description:
For diff merge commits, the list of paths in the commit is based on the diff to the first parent.

When rendering the changeset (or adding it to a Crucible review), the ancestors FishEye compares those files to might not be the ones that the path list was taken from producing unexpected results.
fields.summary: Git merge commits can show wrong diffs

fields.description:
As a developer, it would be helpful if Fisheye recognized that a file was renamed in a changeset handling both cases when there were additional changes or when nothing else but the filename changed.

Currently, Fisheye displays the file as removed and added, making it hard to see if something else than the filename changed or not.
fields.summary: Recognize file renaming in code reviews

It would be nice to have FishEye retrieve all this information from Stash.
fields.summary: Stash Integration for Adding Git Repositories in FishEye

fields.description:
h3.Steps to reproduce
# Start FishEye/Crucible 3.1.5
# Integrate with JIRA 6.1.3
# Perform the following smart commit to JIRA:
{noformat}
TST-1 #time 1h smart commit 1
{noformat}
# Make sure that it is working in JIRA
# Shutdown JIRA 6.1.3
# Perform the following smart commit to JIRA:
{noformat}
TST-1 #time 1h smart commit 2
{noformat}
This will be the failed smart commit
# Start JIRA 6.1.3
# Make sure that the smart commit does not work in JIRA
# Stop FishEye/Crucible 3.1.5
# Upgrade it to FishEye/Crucible 3.2.3
# Check the JIRA issue TST-1 again
The failed smart commit is added to JIRA again

Even though the failed smart commit is added to JIRA again, it is processed with the time of the upgrade (the log time in JIRA is added on the time of the upgrade). However, the failed smart commit might be added 2 weeks ago.

Have tested that all the failed smart commit will be reprocessed again till the last successful smart commit. 

It will be better if the smart commit is added to JIRA with the time of the commit (not the time during upgrade).
fields.summary: Failed Smart Commit should use the commit time when reprocessed

fields.description:
When deploying fisheye, and editing config.xml, I stumbled across this problem.

I tried to add a truststore containing the CACert root certificate, as this is not included in the default truststore in ${JAVA_HOME}/jre/lib/security/cacerts.

However, the config.xsd schema looks like it only supports the definition of truststores with ssl hosts, of which I have none. All SSL is done by my reverse proxy.

I fixed the problem temporarily by adding CACert to ${JAVA_HOME}/jre/lib/security/cacerts, but it would be convenient to be able to add a truststore even when only using http hosts.

Editing the config through the webinterface was also unsuccessful, as changes to the truststore fields are not saved unless a ssl host is specified.
fields.summary: Define a truststore when using only a http host

fields.summary: Disable or Remove "Clone in SourceTree" Button
Smart commit parser isn't able to handle issue key in command body

fields.description:
If for some reason the {{config.xml}} gets corrupted, customers need to restore one from a backup, *if* they have a backup.
In this case, if the corrupted {{config.xml}} had more repositories than the one from the backup, customers would need to redefine all the missing repositories using the web interface and re-index them. 
If these repositories are huge, FishEye might take a long time to finish indexing them.

In order to avoid this, repository configuration would better be moved to the database.
fields.summary: Move repository configuration to database

fields.description:
Currently FishEye will ask for a CAPTCHA verification if an user fails to log in a pre-defined number of times. In enterprise environments this is insufficient and there should be an option to:
- Lock an user account after a pre-defined number of failed login attempts
- Lock an user temporarily (for a pre-defined period of time) after a pre-defined number of failed login attempts
fields.summary: Option to lock/suspend an user after a number of failed login attempts

fields.description:
Use-case scenario:

A group of software developers works a lot with Matlab models. To auto generate code they need to be able to set a different diff tool for those files. Even Excel files are used a lot for different reasons and FishEye doesn't seem to be able to diff those either.

It would be nice to at least be able to open them both in Excel and diff as you can in Tortoise SVN for example. Alternatively, to have the possibility to change the diff tool per filetype or any other convenient way to diff non-text based files.
fields.summary: Plugable External Diff Tools

fields.description:
When rendering the source view, ViewFileAction.getBlame() calls Svn2Cache.getBlame to get the blame chunks to render.  This in turn calls BaseRevisionCache.getBlameSpans().  This does not always return all the blame spans for a file.

I have not been able to understand the exact cause but the issue can be reproduced by indexing the attached SVN dump and attempting to view source of revision 13.  Nothing is shown due to a javascript error, and the javascript error occurs because of incorrectly formed JSON that exists because not all blame spans are returned.


The URL: /browse/try/a/s/asd/q.txt?r1=13&r2=13&u=20
fields.summary: Source view can fail to render with a javascript error because BaseRevisionCache.getBlameSpans does not always return all the blame spans for a given file

fields.description:
When searching for a phrase in fisheye there is no progress indicator displayed when counts for other facets are calculated.
Scenario:

https://FISHEYE/qsearch?q=test)  
 2. progress indicator is displayed
 3. then first (i.e. "Files and directories") facet count and content to be displayed
 4. but then progress indicator is no longer shown, although the counts for other facets are not displayed and I can see Ajax request in progress to /qsearch?q=test&countsOnly=true&_nocache=1389257647375
 after the count for first "Files and directories" 

See !http://monosnap.com/image/ULx3aATGc8UyGk417RZCB984G.png|width=33%!
fields.summary: no progress indicator shown in quicksearch when counting other docs

fields.description:
JIRA allows users to be deactivated / disabled which removes them from the JIRA license count. When FishEye uses JIRA as a user server, the deactivated users aren't allowed to log in but they still appear in the user list and thus count against the license seat count. 

*Workaround*: Remove the user from the groups being synched.
fields.summary: Deactivated JIRA users still count against license seats

fields.description:

fields.description:
I have disabled users in my Jira (v6.1.5) user base, which is leveraged by FE via Application Link.

However, those disabled users still show up in FE and use up license counts, such that I am blocked from adding new enabled users for FE.
fields.summary: Disabled user still counts towards license limit
